comments: Expansion of cos(x^2).Bisection of sequence A001813 - Gary W. Adamson, Jul 19 2011
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100
formula: Integral representation as n-th moment of a positive function on a positive half-axis, in Maple notation: a(n)=int((1/4)*exp(-1/4*sqrt(x))/(sqrt(Pi)*x^(3/4)), x=0..infinity), n=0, 1... - _Karol A. Penson_, Sep 19 2001Contribution from Gary W. Adamson, Jul 19 2011: (Start)a(n) = upper left term of M^(2n), where M = an infinite square production matrix as follows:  2, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0,...  4, 4, 4, 0, 0, 0,...  6, 6, 6, 6, 0, 0,...  8, 8, 8, 8, 8, 0,...  ... (end)
mathematica: Table[(4n)!/(2n)!,{n,0,10}] (* or *) With[{nn=60},Abs[Take[ CoefficientList[ Series[ Cos[x^2],{x,0,nn}],x] Range[0,nn]!,{1,-1,4}]]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 27 2012 *)
author: _R. H. Hardin_
